comment.author: 38101324@N00
comment._content: This picture most definitely belongs to the train crash at Martin's Creek, NJ on April 29th, 1911 as reported in the New York Times here: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B0DE7DB1431E233A... (Report source Easton, PA and description match.)

comment.author: 14278080@N02
comment._content:
From NY Times, April 13, 1911

query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B0DE7DB1431E233A...

EASTON, Penn., April 29. -- A train, carrying 169 school teachers, friends, and relatives, bound from Utica, Syracuse, and Waterville, N.Y., to Washington, was hurled down a forty-foot embankment at Martin's Creek, N.J., nine miles north of this place, about 3 o'clock this afternoon.

comment.author: 64018730@N07
comment._content: Wrecked of teachers' train. So, does it contains teachers during the event? - lirr train schedule
